  • 1977:In 1977, Yarborough won the Daytona 500 again, this time driving the No. 21 Wood Brothers Racing Ford. This victory cemented his status as a racing legend.
  • 1984:Yarborough achieved his third and final Daytona 500 victory in 1984, driving the No. 28 Blue Max Ford for Junior Johnson. This victory demonstrated his enduring skill and consistency.

NASCAR Cup Series Championships

Yarborough’s dominance in the NASCAR Cup Series is unparalleled. He secured three consecutive championships, a feat that remains a testament to his remarkable consistency and strategic brilliance.

  • 1977:Yarborough successfully defended his championship title in 1977, once again driving the No. 21 Wood Brothers Racing Ford. This victory solidified his status as a racing legend.
  • 1978:Yarborough achieved his third consecutive NASCAR Cup Series championship in 1978, driving the No. 21 Wood Brothers Racing Ford. This accomplishment cemented his legacy as one of the greatest drivers in NASCAR history.
